peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much does an art appraisal cost?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: For collections of artwork, you can estimate that the cost of an appraisal document, after on-site inspection, photography, cataloging, comparative data research and document preparation will be between $200 - $250 per item, depending on the complexity of research required.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: FAQs | Fine Art Appraisal for Insurance

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can I get my artwork valued?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The best way to value old art is to let a professional do it. You can submit works to some auction houses for appraisal or find private appraisers, museums, or art professionals.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: What is the best way to value very old art? - Quora

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much does an art valuation cost?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The certificate of valuation costs $250 (including GST) for the first artwork, with each additional original painting valued at $125.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Hart Art Valuations & Appraisals - David Hart Galleries

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Are art appraisals worth it?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: To find out more about your artwork: An art appraisal can tell you more about your artwork, such as its history, provenance, and condition. This information can be helpful in making decisions about how to care for your artwork.
